info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 4:14AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of moderate to heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a half of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 413 AM EST, a band of moderate to heavy snow was along a line extending from near Philmont to Milton to near Fleischmanns and moving southeast at 25 MPH. THIS BAND OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Saugerties, Livingston and Saugerties South around 420 AM EST. Copake and Clermont around 425 AM EST. Great Barrington and Red Hook around 430 AM EST. Sheffield, Ancram, Mount Tremper and Woodland Valley Campground around 440 AM EST. Pine Plains, Canaan, Ashley Falls, Kenneth L Wilson Campground and West Shokan around 450 AM EST. Woodstock and West Hurley around 455 AM EST. Millerton around 500 AM EST. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 21. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
